title: Child Custody
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"It’s All About Your \u003cspan\u003eChildren\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"When children are involved, the difficult process of divorce becomes even more complicated. You’ll need to consider parenting plans, visitation schedules, child support, and grandparents’ rights. Both parents are obligated to support their children financially, whether or not they have custody. You also need to think about how your child’s needs might change as they grow. With so many factors to consider, a seasoned attorney can help you navigate child custody with care so that you can create the best possible outcome for your family.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

meta.articlecategory_description: Child support ensures your children’s needs are covered after a divorce, including housing, education, healthcare, and daily expenses. If both spouses agree on support, it’s often a smooth process; if not, a court may have to step in to establish a fair support plan.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Redefining How Your Family Functions - Learn about custody, parenting plans, visitation schedules, child support, grandparents rights, and more.

title: Spousal Support
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Spousal Support in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"A \u003cspan\u003eBalanced\u003c/span\u003e Financial \u003cbr\u003e Future","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13422,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89412,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Finding an \u003cspan\u003eEquitable Way\u003c/span\u003e Forward","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Spousal support, or alimony, aims to create more financial equity during and after divorce. Multiple factors help determine spousal support, like each spouse's income, debts, and potential earning power, the assets and property being divided, the children involved, how wealth is distributed in the relationship and any disparities that exist, and the state and local laws where you reside. When facing divorce, couples can reach an agreement about spousal support on their own, through mediation, or the court can decide.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_intro_buttons","bottom_tag_line":"","_bottom_tag_line":"field_intro_bottom_tag_line","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

meta.articlecategory_description: Also known as alimony, spousal support helps ensure an equal financial footing during and after divorce. Many factors are considered, such as each spouse’s income, debts, assets, local laws, etc. Divorce couples can settle spousal support on their own, with a mediator, or through a court.
meta._yoast_wpseo_title: DivorceLawyer.com Divorce Categories - Spousal Support & Alimony
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Alimony, or spousal support, aims to create more financial equity during and after divorce. Learn how to find an equitable way forward for your future.
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Alimony, or spousal support, aims to create more financial equity during and after divorce. Learn how to find an equitable way forward for your future.
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Alimony, or spousal support, aims to create more financial equity during and after divorce. Learn how to find an equitable way forward for your future.

title: Finances
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Finances in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","title_heading_tag":"h1","_title_heading_tag":"field_hero_component_secondary_title_heading_tag","subtitle":"Protecting \u003cbr\u003e Your \u003cspan\u003eFinancial\u003c/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e Future","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","sub_title_heading_tag":"h2","_sub_title_heading_tag":"field_hero_component_secondary_sub_title_heading_tag","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13421,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":"","_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","column_image_cover":"0","_column_image_cover":"field_hero_component_secondary_column_image_cover","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Your \u003cspan\u003eFinancial\u003c/span\u003e Roadmap","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Money makes the world go around, and your world is about to get a makeover. As you prepare for divorce, you’ll want to take stock of your financial picture, including your current assets, debts, properties, business interests, and retirement accounts. You’ll also want to consider your future financial needs and create a post-divorce budget that includes your new living arrangements and ongoing expenses. With a firm understanding of your financial picture, a trusted team of legal and financial advisors can guide you through the arduous process of dividing assets, ensuring adequate spousal and child support, safeguarding retirement savings, and minimizing the financial disruption caused by divorce.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_intro_buttons","bottom_tag_line":"","_bottom_tag_line":"field_intro_bottom_tag_line","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

meta.articlecategory_description: To help lessen the financial impact of divorce and set yourself up for a smoother transition, it is crucial to assess your financial standing. Take stock of your assets, debts, properties, and future financial needs, and create a budget for life after divorce. When you have a clear picture of your finances, it becomes easier to navigate dividing assets, securing support, safeguarding your retirement savings, and more.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Your Financial Roadmap in Divorce - Focusing on minimizing the financial disruption caused by divorce
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Your Financial Roadmap in Divorce - Focusing on minimizing the financial disruption caused by divorce
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Your Financial Roadmap in Divorce - Focusing on minimizing the financial disruption caused by divorce

title: Business Interests
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Balancing Personal Interests with \u003cspan\u003eBusiness Health\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Business interests in divorce can complicate the division of assets, especially if they represent a substantial part of your wealth or retirement plan. Determining the value of business ownership is critical and may require professional valuation. Whether you or your spouse started the business or it was a joint venture, decisions must be made about whether it will be sold, one party will buy out the other, or if continued co-ownership is feasible. The best possible outcome ensures that the business remains viable while fairly dividing its value. Legal and financial guidance is often necessary to navigate these complex decisions.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_intro_buttons","bottom_tag_line":"","_bottom_tag_line":"field_intro_bottom_tag_line","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

meta.articlecategory_description: Dividing business interests during divorce can be challenging,  especially if they make up a big part of your wealth. You will likely have to decide whether to sell, buy out your spouse, or continue co-ownership. The aim is to ensure the business stays strong while fairly dividing its value, which may require legal and financial guidance.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Divorce and Business Ownership – Who Gets What? Balancing personal interests with business health and the division of assets in divorce
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Divorce and Business Ownership – Who Gets What? Balancing personal interests with business health and the division of assets in divorce
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Divorce and Business Ownership – Who Gets What? Balancing personal interests with business health and the division of assets in divorce

title: Separation
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Separation in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"Transition Towards Your \u003cspan\u003eIndependence\u003c/span\u003e","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","hero_image":13419,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":"","_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Moving \u003cspan\u003eAway\u003c/span\u003e from a Life Together","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Separation is a definitive test of how you want to move forward with your life. It includes many of the same decisions that you will be faced with in divorce, like asset division, living arrangements, financial support, and child or pet custody. Separation allows couples to try out their new, separate lives while working through the legal and emotional complexities of their situation. Separation can be a time for reflection and negotiation. It sets the stage for couples to either find their way back to each other and reconcile their relationship or, if needed, prepare for divorce.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_intro_buttons","bottom_tag_line":"","_bottom_tag_line":"field_intro_bottom_tag_line","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

meta.articlecategory_description: Separation can be a time for reflection, potentially leading to reconciliation or preparing for divorce if necessary. It is a time that helps couples experience life apart while navigating the legal and emotional aspects of their situation.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Transition Towards Your Independence - Resources for handling separation and divorce. Get the support and expert guidance you need here.
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Transition Towards Your Independence - Resources for handling separation and divorce. Get the support and expert guidance you need to navigate this challenging time.
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Transition Towards Your Independence - Resources for handling separation and divorce. Get the support and expert guidance you need to navigate this challenging time.

title: Behavioral Issues
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Behavioral Issues in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"When Toxic \u003cspan\u003eBehavior\u003c/span\u003e Ruins Your Marriage","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13418,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89415,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Ensuring \u003cspan\u003eSafety \u0026 Emotional\u003c/span\u003e Well-Being","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"When facing divorce, behavioral issues like cheating, addiction, abuse, narcissism, and domestic violence can significantly impact the emotional and practical aspects of the separation process. You may face heightened conflicts, communication breakdowns, and emotional instability, which can complicate negotiations, lead to prolonged disputes, and create an emotionally or physically unsafe environment for you, your spouse, or your children. Addressing these issues often requires professional help, such as counseling or mediation. A seasoned attorney can help determine how these factors play into the outcomes of your divorce and, if needed, can ask the court to put safeguards in place during and after the process to help achieve a fair, peaceful, and healthier transition.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_intro_buttons","bottom_tag_line":"","_bottom_tag_line":"field_intro_bottom_tag_line","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

meta.articlecategory_description: Behavioral issues such as addiction, cheating, domestic violence, or abuse can make divorce more challenging, causing conflict and emotional stress. When navigating these difficulties, professional help (such as counseling or mediation) can be vital. Counting on an experienced attorney can also help ensure your safety and work toward a fair and peaceful outcome.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: When Toxic Behavior Ruins Your Marriage - Navigating behavioral issues in divorce so you can achieve a fair and healthier transition.
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: When Toxic Behavior Ruins Your Marriage - Navigating behavioral issues in divorce so you can achieve a fair and healthier transition.
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: When Toxic Behavior Ruins Your Marriage - Navigating behavioral issues in divorce so you can achieve a fair and healthier transition.

title: The Divorce Process
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Navigating the \u003cspan\u003eEnd\u003c/span\u003e of a Marriage","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"The road to divorce can be long and filled with contemplation. In addition to the emotional journey ahead, it is important to understand and prepare for the legal exercise of ending a marriage. Your unique circumstances, including local and state laws, will define the exact process. It generally begins with one spouse filing for divorce and sets out to clarify key issues like asset division, spousal support, and child custody. If both parties can agree on the terms, the process can move along quite quickly. If not, you may find yourself working through differences with mediation or in court where a judge will make the final decisions. A trusted attorney can help you explore the best approach based on your unique situation.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_intro_buttons","bottom_tag_line":"","_bottom_tag_line":"field_intro_bottom_tag_line","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

meta.articlecategory_description: Divorce involves both emotional and legal preparation and can be a long, contemplative process. Usually, it begins when one spouse files for divorce, addressing factors such as asset division, custody, and support. Agreements make it quick, but disagreements may require mediation or court involvement. It is essential to count on a trusted attorney to guide you through it all.
